chapter.title: JAX-RS doclet documentation
chapter.para: The JAX-RS doclet generates documentation for your RESTful service based on JAX-RS annotations and JavaDoc comments on your JAX-RS resource methods.

section.title: Where should you write JavaDoc
section.para: JavaDoc is read either on the JAX-RS resource methods, or their interface. Only method-level JavaDoc is used. Documentation for a given RESTful URL is taken from the method annotated with @GET, @HEAD, @POST, @PUT or @DELETE for that URL (in order of preference).
section.remark: Since the JAX-RS supports links to JAXB documentation, you should first run the JAXB doclet, then the JAX-RS doclet using the -link parameter.

section.title: Supported standard JavaDoc tags
section.para: The following standard JavaDoc tags are supported on resource methods:

tr.td: This is used to document the corresponding resource method parameters annotated with @PathParam, @QueryParam or @MatrixParam. Can be used at most once per parameter name.
Documents the entity returned from this resource method. Can only be used once.

section.title: Supported specific JavaDoc tags
section.para: The following specific JavaDoc tags are supported on resource methods:

tr.td: This is used to document the codes that the method can return. Can be used multiple times.
Specifies the real type of input when declared as a String parameter. Can only be used once.
Used in place of @return when output type is String, void or Response to specify the real type of output and documentation for each possible type. Can be used multiple times.
This is used to document HTTP request headers. Can be used multiple times.
This is used to document HTTP response headers. Can be used multiple times.
